title: About
text: This is the development documentation site for NorEden Project.

title: Problem definition
text:
Understand the data
Load the aggregated food groups and their attributes. We have 25 food groups.

foods <- read.csv('data/foods.csv', sep = ',')
data.table::setDT(foods) # use data.table format
head(foods) 

           food intake energy protein   fat carbs sugar alcohol  ghge
1:        Bread  175.4 10.696   0.091 0.030 0.441 0.002       0 0.001
2: Other grains   45.0 14.022   0.100 0.042 0.607 0.011       0 0.002
3:        Cakes   35.6 14.185   0.067 0.152 0.424 0.185       0 0.002
4:     Potatoes   67.8  3.791   0.021 0.007 0.178 0.000       0 0.000
5:   Vegetables  154.6  1.565   0.015 0.008 0.050 0.005       0 0.001
6:      Legumes    3.5  8.571   0.143 0.029 0.286 0.000       0 0.001


Define the constraints on

energy
protein, fat, carbs, sugar, alcohol
GHGE (greenhouse gas equivalent)


constraints <- data.frame(
  constraint = c('lower', 'upper'), 
  energy = c(9000, 10000), 
  protein = c(55, 111.5), 
  fat = c(61.8, 98.8), 
  carbs = c(250, 334.6), 
  sugar = c(0, 54.8), 
  alcohol = c(0, 10),
  ghge = c(0, 4.7)
)
constraints

  constraint energy protein  fat carbs sugar alcohol ghge
1      lower   9000    55.0 61.8 250.0   0.0       0  0.0
2      upper  10000   111.5 98.8 334.6  54.8      10  4.7


Now we can examine whether the current intake satisfy the constraints.

t(as.matrix(foods$intake)) %*% as.matrix(foods[, .(energy, protein, fat, carbs, sugar, alcohol, ghge)])

       energy protein     fat    carbs   sugar alcohol   ghge
[1,] 9314.278 98.2159 85.7644 234.7172 39.2148  8.6498 3.7807


It looks like all categories but carbs fall within the expected range. Carb is slighter lower than the lower threshold.

title: NorEden
text:
Personliste
1187 subjects
sex, age, height, weight, BMI,…


xx. Stoffinntak per person
Nutrition intake
Can be linked with personliste via ID
Can be linked with Alle matvarer naringsstoffer ICs (impact category)
(energyprosenfordeling per person also has nutrients, but slightly mismathed)


xx Matinntak for gruppen
same info as alle matvarer, do not need.
Matvarers bidrag av stoffer

Alle matvarer ICs
Env impact for each food and nutritional

title: NorEden
text:
Cleghorn 2022
Optimise NZ versio nof EAT-lancet diet
Model impact on population health
Constraints

population diet meets the nutritional recommendations
diet related greenhouse gas emission within boundary
diet cost witthin baseline cost of average diet


DIET multi-state life-table modelling
population (4.4m), modeled until deah/110 yo + sex, age, ethnicity
dietary risk factors: red meat, processed meat, sugar beverage, sodium, low fruit, …
9 diseases: coronary heart disease, stroke, …



Walker 2021
PuLP (python), linear optimizationn to determine the lowest possible impact diet for each scenario
env impact:

Climate change
biodiversity loss

title: NorEden
text:
Linear programming LP
Objective linear, constraints linear equalities or inequalities
maximise f(x) = cx
s.t. Ax <= b
x>= 0

title: NorEden
text:
Quadratic programming
some QP are convex, some not
Constraints: linear equality or inequality
minimize 1/2 x^t Q x + c^t x
s.t. Ax < b

title: NorEden
text:
Nonlinear optimizaion (more general than QP)
minimize f(x)
s.t. g(x) <= 0
h(x) = 0
xl <= x <= xu
